GCBQURY.GCBQURY_QUERY_STRING: SELECT spriden_pidm FROM spriden, spbpers WHERE spriden_change_ind IS NULL AND spriden_pidm = spbpers_pidm AND spbpers_sex = 'F'
SELECT spriden_pidm FROM spriden, spbpers WHERE spriden_change_ind IS NULL AND spriden_pidm = spbpers_pidm AND spbpers_sex = 'M'

GCBQURY.GCBQURY_DESCRIPTION: Population with Spriden ID like A0000091
GCBQURY.GCBQURY_QUERY_STRING: Select spriden_pidm from spriden where spriden_change_ind is null and spriden_id like 'A0000091%'

GCBQURY.GCBQURY_DESCRIPTION: Population with last name like Smi*
GCBQURY.GCBQURY_QUERY_STRING: SELECT spriden_pidm FROM spriden WHERE spriden_last_name LIKE 'Smi%'
select spriden_pidm from spriden where spriden_first_name = 'Mickey'

GCBQURY.GCBQURY_DESCRIPTION: List of Applicants that did not enroll
List of students applying for FinAid not registered
List of Students with a Registration Hold
Students assigned to a specific class
GCBQURY.GCBQURY_QUERY_STRING: select sfrstcr_pidm from sfrstcr where sfrstcr_term_code = '500001' and sfrstcr_crn = '5001'

GCBQURY.GCBQURY_DESCRIPTION: List of students that graduated in term X
List of all employees in department X

GCBQURY.GCBQURY_QUERY_STRING: select sfrstcr_pidm from sfrstcr where sfrstcr_term_code = '200910' and sfrstcr_crn = '10020'
select sfrstcr_pidm from sfrstcr where sfrstcr_term_code = '200899' and sfrstcr_crn = '10012'

GCRCFLD.GCRCFLD_RULE_STATEMENT: select GOREMAL_EMAIL_address from goremal where goremal_pidm = :pidm and GOREMAL_emal_code = 'CAMP'
select stvbldg_desc from stvbldg, slrrasg Where stvbldg_code = slrrasg_bldg_code and slrrasg_pidm = :pidm and slrrasg_term_code = '201430'
select stvtesc_desc description, sortest_test_score score from stvtesc, sortest where sortest_pidm = :pidm and stvtesc_code = sortest_tesc_code
select spraddr_zip from spraddr where spraddr_pidm = :pidm and spraddr_atyp_code = 'PR' and spraddr_from_date <= SYSDATE
select spraddr_zip from spraddr where spraddr_pidm = :pidm and spraddr_atyp_code = 'MA' and spraddr_from_date <= SYSDATE
select sorfolk_parent_first, sorfolk_parent_last from sorfolk where sorfolk_pidm = :pidm and sorfolk_relt_code = 'F'
select sorfolk_parent_first, sorfolk_parent_last from sorfolk where sorfolk_pidm = :pidm and sorfolk_relt_code = 'M'
select to_char(sysdate,'Month DD, YYYY') today from spriden where spriden_pidm = :pidm

select stvhldd_desc description, sprhold_reason reason from sprhold, stvhldd where stvhldd_code = sprhold_hldd_code and sprhold_from_date <= SYSDATE and sprhold_to_date > SYSDATE and sprhold_pidm = :pidm

GCRCFLD.GCRCFLD_DESCRIPTION: Preferred email as defined in Banner
GCRCFLD.GCRCFLD_RULE_STATEMENT: select GOREMAL_EMAIL_address from goremal where goremal_pidm = :pidm and GOREMAL_PREFERRED_IND = 'Y'

GCRCFLD.GCRCFLD_DESCRIPTION: Parents email as defined in Banner
GCRCFLD.GCRCFLD_RULE_STATEMENT: select GOREMAL_EMAIL_address from goremal where goremal_pidm = :pidm and GOREMAL_emal_code = 'PEML'
select spraddr_city from spraddr where spraddr_pidm = :pidm and SPRADDR_ATYP_CODE = 'PR'
Select SPBPERS_SSN from spbpers where spbpers_pidm = :pidm
select spbpers_sex gender from spbpers where spbpers_pidm = :pidm
select stvstat_desc from stvstat, spraddr where spraddr_pidm = :pidm and SPRADDR_ATYP_CODE = 'MA' and stvstat_code = spraddr_stat_code
select stvnatn_nation from stvnatn, spraddr where spraddr_pidm = :pidm and SPRADDR_ATYP_CODE = 'MA' and stvnatn_code = spraddr_natn_code
Select spriden_id from spriden where spriden_pidm = :pidm and spriden_change_ind is null
select spriden_first_name from spriden where spriden_pidm = :pidm and spriden_change_ind is null
select spriden_last_name from spriden where spriden_pidm = :pidm and spriden_change_ind is null
select spbpers_name_prefix from spbpers where spbpers_pidm = :pidm
select spbpers_name_suffix from spbpers where spbpers_pidm = :pidm
select spraddr_city from spraddr where spraddr_pidm = :pidm and SPRADDR_ATYP_CODE = 'MA'
select stvstat_desc from stvstat, spraddr where spraddr_pidm = :pidm and SPRADDR_ATYP_CODE = 'PR' and stvstat_code = spraddr_stat_code
select stvnatn_nation from stvnatn, spraddr where spraddr_pidm = :pidm and SPRADDR_ATYP_CODE = 'PA' and stvnatn_code = spraddr_natn_code
select slrrasg_room_number room from slrrasg Where slrrasg_pidm = :pidm and slrrasg_term_code = '201430'
select stvastd_desc from stvastd, shrttrm where stvastd_code = shrttrm_astd_code_end_of_term and shrttrm_pidm = :pidm and shrttrm_term_code = '201410'
select spraddr_street_line1, spraddr_street_line2, spraddr_street_line3 from spraddr where spraddr_pidm = :pidm and spraddr_atyp_code = 'MA' and spraddr_from_date <= SYSDATE
select sprtele_phone_area, sprtele_phone_number from sprtele where sprtele_pidm = :pidm and sprtele_tele_code = 'PR'

SELECT DECODE (spbpers_sex,'F','Y',NULL) isfemale ,spriden_first_name first ,spriden_last_name last FROM spbpers, spriden WHERE spriden_change_ind IS NULL AND spbpers_pidm = spriden_pidm AND spriden_pidm = :pidm
select spraddr_street_line1, spraddr_street_line2, spraddr_street_line3 from spraddr where spraddr_pidm = :pidm and spraddr_atyp_code = 'PR' and spraddr_from_date <= SYSDATE

TimeTicket SELECT 'Open Date/Time: ' || TRUNC (c.SFRWCTL_BEGIN_DATE) || ' at ' || c.SFRWCTL_HOUR_BEGIN || ' ' || 'Close Date/Time: ' || TRUNC (c.SFRWCTL_END_DATE) || ' at ' || c.SFRWCTL_HOUR_END FROM sfbrgrp t, sfbwctl g, sfrwctl c WHERE t.SFBRGRP_PIDM = :PIDM AND t.SFBRGRP_TERM_CODE = '201430' AND t.SFBRGRP_TERM_CODE = g.SFBWCTL_TERM_CODE AND t.SFBRGRP_RGRP_CODE = g.SFBWCTL_RGRP_CODE AND g.SFBWCTL_TERM_CODE = c.SFRWCTL_TERM_CODE AND g.SFBWCTL_PRIORITY = c.SFRWCTL_PRIORITY ORDER BY c.SFRWCTL_BEGIN_DATE, c.SFRWCTL_HOUR_BEGIN, c.SFRWCTL_END_DATE, c.SFRWCTL_HOUR_END;

GCBTMPL.GCBTMPL_DESCRIPTION: Template letter for individuals who have some missing documents
Letter to the applicants for attending the Open House

GCBTMPL.GCBTMPL_NAME: Dean's letter for award winning individuals
GCBTMPL.GCBTMPL_DESCRIPTION: Letter for those individuals who received awards

GCBEMTL.GCBEMTL_CONTENT:
$Date_Current$

 

Dear $First_Name$ $Last_Name$,

 

Our records indicate that we are missing some documentation for your change to Housing request due to your new RA status.  Please provide the documentation listed below and we will process the change as soon as possible.  

 

  • $ID$
  • $GPA$
  • $Advisor$
  • Letter of acknowledgement 

 

Be advised that $Housing_Building$ is a very populated building and time is of the essence to guarantee a space for you.

Congratulations on your assignment and we look forward to hearing from you.

 

Sincerely,

Mr. John Smith

Residential Coordinator.

Dear $First_Name$,

 

 

With the term coming to an end and the holiday season approaching, I have been making a conscious effort to reflect on what is right with the world and with our community. As I told our students in a letter I sent to them this weekend, I see evidence of what is right on this campus everyday, in the classrooms, on the playing fields, in the dining halls, across student groups.

 

 

During Winter Break (December 21 – January 25), some students spend Winter Break with family, traveling or pursuing off-campus activities. Other students return to campus early to participate in Wintersession, featuring student-initiated and College-led programs. Whatever your student chooses to do over break, they should do what is best for them.  Information for Wintersession can be found at https://www.facebook.com/WintersessionHarvard

 

 

We are all so fortunate to be part of a community that pushes each of us to stretch beyond what we thought was possible for ourselves and that holds us to such high standards. I am grateful you are a part of this community.

 

Sincerely,

Dr. John Smith

Dear $First Name$,

 

Thank you for attending our Open House at our Philadelphia Campus.  We hope that you enjoyed the tour and the information was helpful in making a decision to attend our institution.

 

We are looking forward to having you as part of our vibrant community!

 

Sincerely,

Karla Jones

Dean of Admissions

 

Please visit our website for more information at http://www.drexel.edu

Dear $First_Name$,

Registration for the upcoming semester will be opening soon. As of the date of this email your record indicates that you have  holds which will prevent you from registering for courses.

$Holds$

We recommend taking action to resolve these holds as soon as possible so that your registration is not delayed.
For hold detail, please log into MyEllucian Self-Service to view your holds.

To see when you can register visit the following web site http://www.ellucian.edu/registrar/registration/schedule.php . Best wishes on your continued success.

Ellucian University, Office of the Registrar
PLEASE DO NOT RESPOND TO THIS SYSTEM GENERATED MESSAGE

$Date_Current$

 

$First_Name$ $Last_Name$

$Street_Permanent$

$City_ Permanent$, $State_Permanent$  $Zip_Permanent$

 

Dear $First_Name$,

 

Congratulations! Ellucian University is honored to offer you admission for Fall 2014. You are the type of student we want at LUCI.

 

Your admission has been based on your academic record at this time.  You must maintain this level of overall academic performance.  If your high school or college academic record should change, notify this office as soon as possible. All final transcripts, high school and college, must be received in our office before the first day of class.

 

You will find important information that will answer many of your questions regarding the “Next Steps.” Please read the information carefully found at www.ellucian.edu/nextsteps/ to finalize your enrollment.

 

The University encourages you to get involved, enjoy new experiences, discover yourself and make life-long friends. We challenge you to participate in undergraduate research, honors programs, internships, and study abroad. Ellucian University is committed to your success, academically, and personally, and knows that you will thrive under our care.

 

Again, $First_Name$, on behalf of Ellucian University, congratulations.  I want to extend a personal invitation for you to visit us this fall, spring or during one of our Campus Day events.  See all that we have to offer; for the next four years and beyond. Welcome to the Class of 2018! Go Cougars!

 

Best Regards,

John T Pletcher

Director of Admissions

Dear $Name_Prefix$ $First_Name$$Last_Name$

It's time to play "Remember when" at our Doe High Class of '81 reunion next July, and the organizing committee is in high gear!

We'll get started with an informal reception at the Doe House Friday evening, July 14, from 7:00 to 11:00. On Saturday, those interested may sign up for an afternoon of golf or tennis before the dinner dance at the Doe Inn that evening at 7:00 p.m.

We appreciate your help in locating addresses for the following classmates: John Doe, Eric Johnson, Suzanne Smith, and Ryan Moffat.

For your convenience nearest Hotels and Car Rental information is provided. 

 

Hotels Information

 

 

Car Rentals

Best Regards,

Steve Romano

Organizer

Dear $First_Name$,

 

Important information for Phase I Summer registration:

 

1.  Please note that time ticket assignments are currently available. Phase I     

    Summer registration begins Monday, March 31 and concludes on Friday, Apr. 25

    at 4:00 PM ET.  Registration time tickets are assigned based on hours earned

    and will be released incrementally over several days.

 

               $Time_Ticket$

 

2.  Many campus departments have the ability to place registration holds on student

    accounts. A registration hold will prevent a student from accessing the

    registration system.  The department that places the hold must also remove the

    hold. If you have a registration hold on your account, please contact the

    appropriate department indicated.

 

               $Holds$

 

3.  Please access Buzzport and follow the links for OSCAR to view your registration

    time ticket assignment, and any holds on your account that will prevent your access

    to registration:

 

      Access www.buzzport.gatech.edu

      Select OSCAR Self Service (Secure Access)

      Select Student Services & Financial Aid

      Select Registration to view registration time ticket assignment

      Select Student Records to view registration holds

 

4.  Registration assistance is available online at www.registrar.gatech.edu via the

    student tab.

$today$

Dear $First_Name$:

Welcome to LUCI Housing for Fall 2014! The staff is looking forward to greeting new residents at check in on Thursday, August 14, 2014.  Students assigned to even numbered floors may move in from 8:30 am until noon.  Students assigned to odd numbered floors may move in from 1:00 pm until 4:00 pm.

Your housing assignment is: Bulding: $Housing_Building$ Room:$Housing_Room$

Your mailing address is:

$First_Name$ $Last_Name$

LUCI University

$Housing_Building$ Box:$Housing_Room$

Boca Raton, FL  31123


Students should report directly to their assigned building during their designated time.  Please note that we will be unable to accommodate early arrivals, so we ask that you make other arrangements if you find it necessary to arrive in Boca Raton prior to August 14th.   You may view your housing assignment information online at My Housing in your MyLUCI "Students" tab.

Don't forget! The remainder of housing charges for the fall semester are due in full by September 1, 2014. You may pay your balance online at

 If you have any questions, please contact LUCI Housing at 561-297-1880 or housing@luci.edu.

We look forward to a great Fall term!

LUCI Housing & Residential Life

Annual Enrollment Reminders: 

 

  • The Benefits Portal at www.xyzlesbenefits.com is open for Annual Enrollment until on November 7, 2014 (8:00 p.m. EST). All new elections will become effective on January 1, 2015, after which the appropriate payroll deductions will occur.
  • XYZLES has a “positive enrollment” process. All benefits-eligible employees will be required to log into the Benefits Portal to review, make any needed updates, and approve your health and welfare elections for 2015 -- even if you are not making any benefit changes.
  • For assistance with logging-in or submitting required benefit-related documents, please contact the Benefits Portal help desk at 1.855.855.11111 between 8:00 a.m. EST to 9:00 p.m. EST on weekdays.  Log-into the Benefits Portal today to review your current 2014 benefits!

 

Marci Leonard, SPHR

Human Resources Manager

XYZLES, LLC

1700 S. Babcock St

Syracuse, NY  13291

(T) 315-308-3876

ALERT:

The Humanities Building-52 on FAU’s Boca Raton campus has issued a boil water notice due to a water main break.  The water main is being repaired and the boil water notice is in effect until further notice.  Do not drink from the building water supply until the notice is lifted.  At this time use the restrooms in adjacent buildings and once water pressure is restored, it is safe to use restrooms and wash your hands. For more information, contact Environmental Health and Safety at 561-297-3129, option 1, or visit www.fau.edu/facilities/ehs/info/DOH_Boil_water_QA.pdf.

Dear Parents and Guardians,

 

With the term coming to an end and the holiday season approaching, I have been making a conscious effort to reflect on what is right with the world and with our community. As I told our students in a letter I sent to them this weekend, I see evidence of what is right on this campus everyday, in the classrooms, on the playing fields, in the dining halls, across student groups.

 

During Winter Break (December 21 – January 25), some students spend Winter Break with family, traveling or pursuing off-campus activities. Other students return to campus early to participate in Wintersession, featuring student-initiated and College-led programs. Whatever your student chooses to do over break, they should do what is best for them.  Information for Wintersession can be found at https://www.facebook.com/WintersessionHarvard

 

We are all so fortunate to be part of a community that pushes each of us to stretch beyond what we thought was possible for ourselves and that holds us to such high standards. I am grateful you are a part of this community.

 

Sincerely,

Dr. John Smith
